content.description:
Use the same start as the

V5 Traverse

, but drop down to the lower rail after matching your hands on the second crimp rail, and continue left with some powerful moves. Top out at the same spot as the

V5 Traverse

.
content.location:
It climbs the right side of the southwest face. Do the same start as the

V5 Traverse

.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and your right hand on a higher crimp. Make a powerful move to another crimp, match your hands, and then do a big move to the sloping lip. Traverse left across the lip until it becomes easy to top out on jugs. It is also possible to top out straight up once you gain the sloper at the lip.
content.location: It is on the far right side of the southwest face.

content.description:
This problem is located on "Boulder I" as described in Colorado Bouldering 1. Great boulder to warm-up on.

Start somewhat low just right of the large scoop and in front off a smaller block. Pull over the overhang to an easy top.
content.protection: Two pads are useful as there is a block directly behind you.
content.location: Boulder I is located by following the dirt road past all of the other boulders. It is one of the farthest blocks down the road and is located on the right hand side of the road.

content.description:
Located on Boulder I, this is a pretty easy problem that starts low and moves over a small overhang. Overall, it is a low ball problem, but it is decent to warm-up upon.

Start left of the scoop in the boulder.
content.location: Boulder I is located by following the dirt road past all of the other boulders. It is one of the farthest blocks down the road and is located on the right hand side of the road.

content.description: Located on Boulder I, this problem starts in the scoop and climbs through the middle to a good top. Hardest part is gaining stance in the scoop.
content.location: Boulder I is located by following the dirt road past all of the other boulders. It is one of the farthest blocks down the road and is located on the right hand side of the road.
